title.narrative: UNESCAP: Value of empowerment and participation on implementing the 2030 Agenda
UNESCAP: Value of empowerment and participation on implementing the 2030 Agenda

description.narrative: Förenta nationernas ekonomiska och sociala kommission för Asien och Stillahavsområdet (ESCAP) har ansökt om 2 700 000 kronor från Sida för att genomföra projektet “The value of empowerment and participation on implementing the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development” i Asien och Stillahavsområdet under perioden 15 oktober 2018–31 december 2019. Insatsen syftar till att förbättra medlemsstater och andra intressenters förståelse kring effekterna av egenmakt (empowerment) och allmänhetens deltagande för att stärka genomförandet av de globala målen för hållbar utveckling i Asien och Stillahavsområdet, särskilt gällande miljörelaterade mål. Projektet kommer specifikt att 1) redogöra för effekterna och värdet av allmänhetens deltagande i beslutsfattandet med fokus på miljörelaterade mål, 2) utveckla en gemensam förståelse för existerande luckor och viktiga prioriteringar för att förbättra egenmakt och deltagande, och 3) stärka den regionala dialogen och förutsättningar för regionalt samarbete kring ökat allmänt deltagande inom forumen Asia-Pacific Forum on Sustainable Development (APFSD) och High-Level Political Forum (HLPF).

The United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (ESCAP) has applied to Sida for funding of 2 700 000 SEK to carry out the “The value of empowerment and participation on implementing the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development” in Asia and the Pacific during the period 1 September 2018-31 December 2019. The intervention aims at improving the understanding of member States and stakeholders on the impacts of empowerment and public participation on strengthening implementation of SDGs in Asia and the Pacific, particularly on the environment-related SDGs. The project will specially 1) provide evidence regarding the impacts and value of public participation for decision-making with a focus on environment-related goals: 2) develop a shared understanding of the gaps and priorities for improving empowerment and participation; and 3) strengthen regional dialogue and basis for regional cooperation on strengthened public participation at the Asia-Pacific Forum on Sustainable Development (APFSD) and the high-level political forum (HLPF).

The United Nations Economic and Social Commission for Asia and the Pacific (ESCAP) has applied to Sida for funding of 2 700 000 SEK to carry out the “The value of empowerment and participation on implementing the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development” in Asia and the Pacific during the period 1 September 2018-31 December 2019 (being extended to 31 December 2021). The intervention aims at improving the understanding of member States and stakeholders on the impacts of empowerment and public participation on strengthening implementation of SDGs in Asia and the Pacific, particularly on the environment-related SDGs. The project will specially 1) provide evidence regarding the impacts and value of public participation for decision-making with a focus on environment-related goals: 2) develop a shared understanding of the gaps and priorities for improving empowerment and participation; and 3) strengthen regional dialogue and basis for regional cooperation on strengthened public participation at the Asia-Pacific Forum on Sustainable Development (APFSD) and the high-level political forum (HLPF). The remaining amount as of 141 676.39 USD will cover the activities until 31 December 2021.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
Results will be concluded under the completion memo by June 2022. Against the Covid challenge, it is noted that the implementing team adapted the strategy, being able to resume activities as planned, and finishing specific outputs on time.
The outputs for 2021 included the following related activities:
- Organize a workshop with UN regional commissions (UN-ECE, UN-ECLAC) and other agencies to exchange perspectives and experiences on the development of regional instruments on access to information, public participation, and access to justice in environmental matters.
Embassys action: The Embassy participated the online event in March 2021 and shared the positive experience being a party to the Aarhus Convention. The results on the workshop will be concluded in the final report.
- Produce a background paper summarizing the state of affairs in ASEAN in regard to access to information, public participation, environmental impact assessments and justice.
Embassys response: the report Assessment of Access to Information, Public Participation and Access to Justice in Environmental Decision Making in ASEAN was produced. It gave the background on the ASEAN work on human rights and environmental nexus, with the clear recommendations and ways forward. This can be used as a basis for the dialogue between the Embassy and ESCAP in the support of ASEAN on Access Rights in the future.
- Organize an expert group meeting to produce recommendations on the development of a taskforce in ASEAN to promote the development of a sub-regional instrument on access to information, public participation, environmental impact assessments and justice.
Embassys action: The Embassy gave the opening remark during the online event in November 2021. A strong buy in and ownership of regional actors particularly AICHR of Access Rights to Environment at ASEAN level was highlighted as an achivement. It was believed there are possibilities for strengthening access to justice, participation and information at the regional level, along the lines of the Aarhus and Escazu treaties. The results of the expert group meeting will be shared in the final report for 2021.
- Produce a document on the advantages of environmental impact assessments, incorporating environmental access rights, to support member States on the achievement of Sustainable Development Goals in the ASEAN region. Update: The results of this document will be shared in the final report for 2021.
- Project Evaluation Embassys response: The evaluation report is still on going and will be finalised by 2022.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
